__NOTOC__ int '''GetPlayerInput''' (int ''numinput'' [, int ''ptr'' ])
== Usage == Behaves just like [[GetPlayerInput]] but measures a pointer instead. See article for more information.
== Parameters == * ''numinput'': The identifier to check. * ''ptr_select'': the pointer to examine. Default is {{c|{{const|AAPTR_DEFAULT}}}}. The function does nothing if the pointer is not a player (AAPTR_TARGET could be a player however, depending on circumstances. It doesn't necessarily have to be AAPTR_PLAYER#.) See [[actor pointers]].
== Return value == Returns the same results as [[GetPlayerInput]], provided the pointer leads to a player.
==Examples== {{noexamples}}
